meta.name: description
meta.content: Learn more and understand better with BrainPOP’s animated movies, games, playful assessments, and activities covering Science, Math, History, English, and more!

meta.name: keywords
meta.content: arts, music, english, health, math, science, social studies, technology, animation, education, quizzes, state standards

link.script:
var content = {"category":{"name":"Health","url":"\/health\/","icons":{"v1":"\/health\/health_white.svg","v2":"\/health\/health_280x280.svg","v3":"\/health\/health_teal.svg","animated":"\/health\/bp_subject_icon_health.js"},"unit":{"name":"Diseases, Injuries, and Conditions","url":"\/health\/diseasesinjuriesandconditions\/","icon":"\/health\/diseasesinjuriesandconditions\/svg_icon.svg","topic":{"synopsis":"It can be scary to hear about a disease outbreak, but learning the facts can help ease your mind. A new coronavirus\u2014a type of virus named for its crown-like shape\u2014emerged in Wuhan, China in 2019, and then spread to people around the world. While the most severe cases often dominate the headlines, they\u2019re not the whole story. Most coronavirus cases have been mild, and healthy bodies can fight off the infection on their own. Find out more about how viruses work, and the best ways to prevent them from infecting more people. Viruses can\u2019t spread without our help, so click play to learn how not<\/i> to help them!","name":"Coronavirus","url":"\/health\/diseasesinjuriesandconditions\/coronavirus","EntryID":"7440","sensetive_topic":"","free":"yes","permafree":"","screenshots":["\/health\/diseasesinjuriesandconditions\/coronavirus\/screenshot1.png","\/health\/diseasesinjuriesandconditions\/coronavirus\/screenshot2.png","\/health\/diseasesinjuriesandconditions\/coronavirus\/screenshot3.png"],"red":"","courses":[],"related_games":[{"EntryID":"309","name":"Time Zone X: Viruses","url":"\/games\/timezonexviruses\/","type":"timezonex","alignments_description":null,"alignment_guid":"FA5F15C6-2F55-11E9-8C27-C202E47ABD6B"},{"EntryID":"276","name":"MedMyst Animal Alert!","url":"\/games\/medmystanimalalert\/","type":"generic_game","alignments_description":"A mysterious disease is affecting people and animals in a distant tropical region. Identify the illness and stop a major outbreak!","alignment_guid":null},{"EntryID":"277","name":"Cool Science Careers: Imagine Yourself","url":"\/games\/coolsciencecareersimagineyourself\/","type":"generic_game","alignments_description":"See what it\u2019s like to be a scientist! Choose between four different careers and test your scientific, deductive, and analytical skills.","alignment_guid":null}],"sortify_games":[],"features":[{"type":"quiz","feature_id":"46715","name":"Quiz","feature_name":"Quiz","alignments_description":"","alignment_guid":null,"requires_flash":"","small_screen_compatible":"Yes","url":"\/health\/diseasesinjuriesandconditions\/coronavirus\/quiz\/","icon":"\/assets\/images\/quiz_svg_icon.svg"},{"type":"challenge","feature_id":"46802","name":"Challenge","feature_name":"Challenge","alignments_description":"Interactive tasks that playfully assess knowledge of a topic.","alignment_guid":null,"requires_flash":"","small_screen_compatible":"","url":"\/health\/diseasesinjuriesandconditions\/coronavirus\/challenge\/","icon":"\/assets\/images\/challenge_svg_icon.svg"},{"feature_id":"7440","type":"make-a-map","name":"Make-a-Map","alignments_description":"A concept mapping tool.","alignment_guid":"EE840030-48FA-11EA-BFD2-FB6340D0EBE0","url":"\/make-a-map\/?topic=\/health\/diseasesinjuriesandconditions\/coronavirus\/","requires_flash":"","small_screen_compatible":""},{"feature_id":"7440","type":"make-a-movie","name":"Make-a-Movie","alignments_description":"A movie-making tool to produce BrainPOP-style movies.","alignment_guid":"77C343E6-48FC-11EA-BB42-B7C0C6E341E8","url":"\/make-a-movie\/?topic=7440","requires_flash":"","small_screen_compatible":""},{"type":"coding","feature_id":"46716","name":"Creative Coding","feature_name":"Creative coding","alignments_description":"Coding projects offered in both text- and block-based coding languages.","alignment_guid":"FD96F256-48FC-11EA-BCEF-FEE989DDA597","requires_flash":"","small_screen_compatible":"","url":"\/health\/diseasesinjuriesandconditions\/coronavirus\/creativecoding\/","icon":"\/assets\/images\/creativecoding_svg_icon.svg","coding_types":{"museum":{"type":"museum","instructions":"Code a digital museum to show what you know about coronaviruses."},"story":{"type":"story","instructions":"Code a conversation to show what you know about coronaviruses."},"flag":{"type":"flag","instructions":"Create a flag that represents coronaviruses."},"newscast":{"type":"newscast","instructions":"Create a newscast about coronaviruses."}}},{"type":"related_reading","feature_id":"46719","name":"Related Reading","feature_name":"Related Reading","alignments_description":"High-interest, informational texts that extend understanding of a topic.","alignment_guid":"726F1C16-48FD-11EA-88B3-F2CFBB319FBD","requires_flash":"","small_screen_compatible":"Yes","url":"\/health\/diseasesinjuriesandconditions\/coronavirus\/relatedreading\/","icon":"\/assets\/images\/relatedreading_svg_icon.svg"},{"type":"transcript","feature_id":"46718","name":"Movie Transcript","feature_name":"Transcript","alignments_description":"","alignment_guid":null,"requires_flash":"","small_screen_compatible":"","url":"\/health\/diseasesinjuriesandconditions\/coronavirus\/transcript\/","icon":""},{"type":"worksheet","feature_id":"46803","name":"Worksheet","feature_name":"Worksheet","alignments_description":"","alignment_guid":null,"requires_flash":"","small_screen_compatible":"","url":"\/health\/diseasesinjuriesandconditions\/coronavirus\/worksheet\/","icon":"\/assets\/images\/worksheet_svg_icon.svg"},{"type":"graphic_organizer","feature_id":"46804","name":"Graphic Organizer","feature_name":"Graphic Organizer","alignments_description":"","alignment_guid":null,"requires_flash":"","small_screen_compatible":"","url":"\/health\/diseasesinjuriesandconditions\/coronavirus\/graphicorganizer\/","icon":"\/assets\/images\/graphicorganizer_svg_icon.svg"},{"type":"vocabulary","feature_id":"46717","name":"Vocabulary","feature_name":"Vocabulary","alignments_description":"","alignment_guid":null,"requires_flash":"","small_screen_compatible":"Yes","url":"\/health\/diseasesinjuriesandconditions\/coronavirus\/vocabulary\/","icon":"\/assets\/images\/vocabulary_svg_icon.svg"},{"EntryID":"276","game":"true","name":"GameUp","url":"\/games\/game-finder\/?game_keyword=topic: Coronavirus&topic_id=83b38647a08de84a","type":"generic_game","requires_flash":"Yes","small_screen_compatible":"","icon":"\/assets\/images\/gameup_svg_icon.svg","count":3}],"feature":{"type":"transcript","name":"Movie Transcript","requires_flash":"","small_screen_compatible":"","url":"\/health\/diseasesinjuriesandconditions\/coronavirus\/transcript\/","EntryID":"46718","icon":"","html_version":"
CORONAVIRUS MOVIE TRANSCRIPT<\/h2>
\r\n
\r\n
Title text reads: The Mysteries of Life with Tim and Moby.<\/i><\/p>
\r\n
A robot, Moby, works on a puzzle in a kitchen. A boy, Tim, enters the room after exercising. He breathes heavily. <\/i><\/p>
\r\n
TIM:<\/b> Ah, nothing like an early morning jog to\u2014 <\/p>
\r\n
Tim has a coughing fit. He drinks from Moby's glass of water to help clear his throat. <\/i><\/p>
\r\n
TIM:<\/b> Whew. <\/p>
\r\n
Moby looks between Tim and the glass of water with disgust. He can't believe Tim drank from his water glass. <\/i><\/p>
\r\n
TIM:<\/b> What? <\/p>
\r\n
Moby uses his pencil to push the glass of water toward Tim. <\/i><\/p>
\r\n
TIM:<\/b> Oh, stop it. <\/p>
\r\n
Moby slides a letter across the table. Tim reaches for the letter. Moby withdraws his hand to avoid touching Tim. Tim frowns, but picks up the letter and reads from it. <\/i><\/p>
\r\n
TIM:<\/b> Dear Tim and Moby, I've been hearing lots of scary stuff in the news about the coronavirus. Can you tell me more about it, please? Thanks, Kahlil. <\/p>
\r\n
TIM:<\/b> Sure thing, Kahlil! Viruses are tiny particles that can invade living cells. There are millions of varieties, with different behaviors, shapes, and structures. Coronaviruses are one group, named for their crown-shaped outline. <\/p>
\r\n
An animation shows several types of viruses. The coronavirus is round and has many spokes, like a crown. <\/i><\/p>
\r\n
TIM:<\/b> Four of these commonly infect humans. <\/p>
\r\n
An animation shows the four coronaviruses that can infect humans. They all have crown-like spokes. <\/i><\/p>
\r\n
TIM:<\/b> A lot of times when you get a cold, it's caused by a coronavirus. <\/p>
\r\n
MOBY:<\/b> Beep? <\/p>
\r\n
TIM:<\/b> Any virus has one goal: to replicate, or make more copies of itself. <\/p>
\r\n
An animation shows a young girl. An inset bubble shows a close-up of cells in her body. A coronavirus attaches itself to one of the cells. <\/i><\/p>
\r\n
TIM:<\/b> But it can\u2019t do that on its own, so it invades an organism and turns its cells into virus factories. <\/p>
\r\n
The coronavirus uses the cell to make copies of itself. The cell disappears, and the coronaviruses invade the other cells. The girl starts to sweat, cough, and develop a runny nose. <\/i><\/p> 
\r\n
TIM:<\/b> This can be unpleasant for the host, the organism that the virus has infected. <\/p>
\r\n
The other infected cells in the bubble disappear. The coronaviruses move around in a swarm. <\/i><\/p>
\r\n
TIM:<\/b> The new coronavirus typically causes coughing and fever. <\/p>
\r\n
The girl sniffles. <\/p><\/i>
\r\n
TIM:<\/b> A healthy body can usually fight off this illness, known as COVID-19, on its own. <\/p>
\r\n
The animation shows time passing. The girl becomes healthy again. <\/p><\/i>
\r\n
TIM:<\/b> Symptoms are mild for most people, especially kids. But in a body with weakened defenses, COVID-19 can become more severe and require medical treatment.  <\/p>
\r\n
An animation shows a woman receiving chemotherapy and an older man. <\/p><\/i>
\r\n
TIM:<\/b> Some people get seriously ill, and that's gotten everyone\u2019s attention. <\/p>
\r\n
MOBY:<\/b> Beep! <\/p>
\r\n
TIM:<\/b> This new coronavirus was first identified in Wuhan, China. <\/p>
\r\n
An animation shows a map of China. The city of Wuhan is marked with a dot. It's located on the eastern side of the country. <\/i><\/p>
\r\n
TIM:<\/b> In late 2019, there was an outbreak\u2014that\u2019s when a disease starts spreading. <\/p>
\r\n
An animation shows several human silhouettes. One red silhouette has the coronavirus. Arrows point from that person to other silhouettes. The arrows represent the spread of the disease. The other silhouettes turn red as they become infected. Arrows point away from them as well. <\/i><\/p>
\r\n
TIM:<\/b> More and more people got sick, first in China and then around the world. <\/p>
\r\n
The animation reveals more contaminated silhouettes. They continue to spread the disease. <\/i><\/p>
\r\n
TIM:<\/b> Entire cities have been quarantined, or closed off, to slow the disease's spread. <\/p>

\r\nAn animation shows a fence that blocks off a city. The sign on the fence reads, \"Quarantine Zone, Infectious Virus, Do Not Enter.\" <\/i><\/p>
\r\n
TIM:<\/b> Fortunately, viruses can't get around without our help. And there's a lot we can do to not help them! <\/p>
\r\n
An animation shows a virus hitchhiking on the side of a road. He extends his thumb to a car and holds up a sign that says, \"Not a virus, promise!\" The car zooms past the virus. <\/i><\/p>
\r\n
TIM:<\/b> Like washing your hands, especially after you use the bathroom and before you eat. That\u2019s always a good idea, and you probably already do it. <\/p>
\r\n
An animation shows a girl washing her hands with soap and water. <\/i><\/p>
\r\n
TIM:<\/b> Scrub with soap for at least 20 seconds to make sure you don't miss any spots. <\/p>
\r\n
An animation shows a timer that rings after 20 seconds. <\/i><\/p>
\r\n
TIM:<\/b> Whenever you cough or sneeze, cover your nose and mouth to help keep any germs contained. <\/p>
\r\n
Tim demonstrates what he means by raising his arm and coughing into the bend of his elbow. <\/i><\/p>
\r\n
TIM:<\/b> And if you\u2019re sick, try to avoid other people\u2014you wouldn\u2019t want to infect them, even if it\u2019s a plain old cold. <\/p>
\r\n
An animation shows a sick person riding public transportation. A red circle with a line through it appears around them. <\/i><\/p>
\r\n
\r\n
MOBY:<\/b> Beep? <\/p>
\r\n
TIM:<\/b> Well, when there's an outbreak where you live, experts recommend some added precautions. Like social distancing: limiting close contact with other people, even if you're not sick.<\/p>
\r\n
An animation shows a large group of human silhouettes gathered in one place. The people spread out until there's an even amount of distance between groups of two or three people. One group in a family turns red, indicating they have the virus.<\/i><\/p>
\r\n
TIM:<\/b> Hang out at home with your family, and keep up with your friends online. <\/p>
\r\n
The outline of a house appears around each family of silhouettes. <\/i><\/p>
\r\n
TIM:<\/b> That gives the virus fewer opportunities to spread around. <\/i><\/p>
\r\n
Arrows emanate from the people who have the virus. The boundary of the houses blocks the arrows. The infected people turn from red back to blue. <\/i><\/p>
\r\n
TIM:<\/b>  Lots of outbreaks have been stopped when enough folks just follow these simple rules. <\/p>
\r\n
MOBY:<\/b> Beep? <\/p>
\r\n
Moby holds up a newspaper. The headline reads, \"Coronavirus Death Toll Rises.\" <\/i><\/p>
\r\n
TIM:<\/b> Yeah, it\u2019s true\u2014some people have died after being infected by the 2019 coronavirus. That's because the virus can infect a person's lungs and make it hard to breathe. Those are the stories we hear about most online and in the news. But the vast majority of cases have been mild. <\/p>
\r\n
An animation shows a news anchor reporting on the coronavirus. The line at the bottom of the screen reads, \"Coronavirus: Time to Panic!\" <\/i><\/p>
\r\n
TIM:<\/b> If you feel overwhelmed by the news, consider limiting how much you let in. <\/p>
\r\n
The animation reveals that the news is playing on Moby's TV. He uses a remote to turn the TV off. <\/i><\/p>
\r\n
TIM:<\/b> Instead of cable news and social media, stick to sources like the World Health Organization. <\/p>
\r\n
An animation shows the logo for the World Health Organization. It's a blue and white design with a snake around a staff. <\/i><\/p>
\r\n
TIM:<\/b> They'll give you the big picture\u2014not just the scary snapshots that make the headlines. And they're organizing experts all over the world to get this coronavirus under control. <\/p>
\r\n
An animation shows a representative from the World Health Organization. She is standing at a podium and speaking about the coronavirus. Health experts in the audience listen and take notes. <\/i><\/p>
\r\n
TIM:<\/b> Still, it's totally normal if the situation's made you a little anxious. <\/p>
\r\n
An animation shows a worried child. He's surrounded by images of the coronavirus, a scary newspaper headline, a quarantine sign, and the TV news report. He furrows his brow and rapidly looks around at the images. <\/i><\/p>
\r\n
TIM:<\/b> Talk to a trusted adult\u2014they can help you put your feelings in perspective. <\/p>
\r\n
An animation shows the child talking to a school nurse. <\/i><\/p>
\r\n
TIM:<\/b> One last thing: Coronavirus doesn't care where you're from or what your background is. So don't let anyone turn this into an excuse to target someone based on how they look. Working together is how we'll beat this thing, so let's stand up for our neighbors. <\/p>
\r\n
An animation shows Tim and Moby back in the kitchen. Tim remembers that he hasn't showered after his run. <\/i><\/p>
\r\n
TIM:<\/b> Okay, I'm a sweaty mess, I gotta rinse off. <\/p>
\r\n
Tim removes his headband and tosses it onto the kitchen table. Moby frowns and picks the headband up using the end of his pencil. <\/i><\/p>
\r\n
TIM:<\/b> Oh, don't be so dramatic. <\/p>
\r\n
Moby extends the pencil with the sweaty headband as far away from himself as possible. He marches out of the kitchen. <\/i><\/p>
\r\n
TIM:<\/b> Where are you going? <\/p>
\r\n
The door shuts. Moby walks to the edge of a large pit in the Earth. Steam rises from the bubbling lava below. Moby holds out his arm to drop the headband into the pit. Tim calls out to Moby. <\/i><\/p>
\r\n
TIM:<\/b> I really think you're overreacting! <\/p>
\r\n
\r\n
\r\n
\r\n","data":[]}}}},"type":"feature","translations":{"classic_quiz":"Classic Quiz","review_quiz":"Review Quiz","printed_quiz":"Printed Quiz"}};
        var settings = {"title":"Coronavirus Movie Transcript - BrainPOP","meta_tags":[],"lrmi":""};
        var global_content = {'cdn_path' : 'https://cdn.brainpop.com', 'movie_cdn_path' : 'https://svideos.brainpop.com'};
